title: Provinces of China
summary: The provincial level administrative divisions (Chinese: 省级行政区; pinyin: Shěngjí Xíngzhèngqū) are the highest-level administrative divisions of China. There are 34 such divisions claimed by the People's Republic of China, classified as 23 provinces (Chinese: 省; pinyin: shěng), five autonomous regions, four municipalities and two special administrative regions.[2] The political status of Taiwan Province along with a small fraction of Fujian Province[lower-greek 1] remain in dispute, those are under separate rule by the Republic of China, which is usually referred to as "Taiwan".
